content: Eric Bergh is a high-risk pregnancy and fetal intervention specialist at the McGovern School of Medicine in Houston, TX. His interests include prenatal diagnosis and fetal intervention / fetal surgery. In addition to providing clinical care, Dr. Bergh is interested in data science, Rstats and EHR systems integration.
summary: Eric Bergh is a high-risk pregnancy and fetal intervention specialist at the McGovern School of Medicine in Houston, TX. His interests include prenatal diagnosis and fetal intervention / fetal surgery. In addition to providing clinical care, Dr. Bergh is interested in data science, Rstats and EHR systems integration.
title: Eric Bergh, MD

content:
Flexibility This feature can be used for publishing content such as:
 Online courses Project or software documentation Tutorials  The courses folder may be renamed. For example, we can rename it to docs for software/project documentation or tutorials for creating an online course.
Delete tutorials To remove these pages, delete the courses folder and see below to delete the associated menu link.
Update site menu After renaming or deleting the courses folder, you may wish to update any [[main]] menu links to it by editing your menu configuration at config/_default/menus.toml.
For example, if you delete this folder, you can remove the following from your menu configuration:
[[main]] name = "Courses" url = "courses/" weight = 50  Or, if you are creating a software documentation site, you can rename the courses folder to docs and update the associated Courses menu configuration to:
[[main]] name = "Docs" url = "docs/" weight = 50  Update the docs menu If you use the docs layout, note that the name of the menu in the front matter should be in the form [menu.X] where X is the folder name. Hence, if you rename the courses/example/ folder, you should also rename the menu definitions in the front matter of files within courses/example/ from [menu.example] to [menu.<NewFolderName>].
summary: Learn how to use Academic's docs layout for publishing online courses, software documentation, and tutorials.
title: Overview

title: Example Page 2

content:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.   Slides can be added in a few ways:
 Create slides using Academic’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.  Further talk details can easily be added to this page using Markdown and $\rm \LaTeX$ math code.
summary: An example talk using Academic's Markdown slides feature.
title: Example Talk

content:
In my job, I make tables all the time
I recently stumbled upon the {gt} package and whoa… these are some great looking tables! You can check out the vignettes here
Even better, they are simple to append to any dplyr pipeline…
Step 1: Load {gt} and {dplyr}
library(gt) library(dplyr)  Step 2:
 Create a simple frequency table, with mtcars, grouped by number of cylinders.
 Dplyr is fast and simple to use, but the console output is not so easy on the eyes…  mtcars %>% group_by(cyl) %>% summarize(N = n()) %>% mutate(Frequency = N/sum(N), Frequency = round(Frequency, 2)) ## # A tibble: 3 x 3 ## cyl N Frequency ## <dbl> <int> <dbl> ## 1 4 11 0.34 ## 2 6 7 0.22 ## 3 8 14 0.44  Step 3: Lets add some {gt} magic…getting better
mtcars %>% group_by(cyl) %>% summarize(N = n()) %>% mutate(Frequency = N/sum(N), Frequency = round(Frequency, 2)) %>% gt() %>% tab_stubhead(label = "Cylinders")  html { font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Helvetica Neue', 'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', Arial, sans-serif; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_table { display: table; border-collapse: collapse; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; color: #333333; font-size: 16px; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* table.background.color */ width: auto; /* table.width */ border-top-style: solid; /* table.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* table.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #A8A8A8; /* table.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* table.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* table.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #A8A8A8; /* table.border.bottom.color */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_heading { background-color: #FFFFFF; /* heading.background.color */ border-bottom-color: #FFFFFF; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_title { color: #333333; font-size: 125%; /* heading.title.font.size */ padding-top: 4px; /* heading.top.padding - not yet used */ padding-bottom: 4px; border-bottom-color: #FFFFFF; border-bottom-width: 0; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_subtitle { color: #333333; font-size: 85%; /* heading.subtitle.font.size */ padding-top: 0; padding-bottom: 4px; /* heading.bottom.padding - not yet used */ border-top-color: #FFFFFF; border-top-width: 0; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_bottom_border { border-bottom-style: solid; /* heading.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* heading.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* heading.border.bottom.color */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_column_spanner { border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-width: 2px; border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; padding-top: 4px; padding-bottom: 4px; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_col_heading { color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* column_labels.background.color */ font-size: 16px; /* column_labels.font.size */ font-weight: initial; /* column_labels.font.weight */ vertical-align: middle; padding: 5px; margin: 10px; overflow-x: hidden; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_columns_top_border { border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_columns_bottom_border { border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-width: 2px; border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_sep_right { border-right: 5px solid #FFFFFF; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_group_heading { padding: 8px; /* row_group.padding */ color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* row_group.background.color */ font-size: 16px; /* row_group.font.size */ font-weight: initial; /* row_group.font.weight */ border-top-style: solid; /* row_group.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* row_group.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.bottom.color */ vertical-align: middle; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_empty_group_heading { padding: 0.5px; color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* row_group.background.color */ font-size: 16px; /* row_group.font.size */ font-weight: initial; /* row_group.font.weight */ border-top-style: solid; /* row_group.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* row_group.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.bottom.color */ vertical-align: middle; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_striped { background-color: #8080800D; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_from_md  :first-child { margin-top: 0; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_from_md  :last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_row { padding-top: 8px; /* row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; margin: 10px; border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 1px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; vertical-align: middle; overflow-x: hidden; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_stub { border-right-style: solid; border-right-width: 2px; border-right-color: #D3D3D3; padding-left: 12px; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_summary_row { color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* summary_row.background.color */ padding-top: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; text-transform: inherit; /* summary_row.text_transform */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_grand_summary_row { color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* grand_summary_row.background.color */ padding-top: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; text-transform: inherit; /* grand_summary_row.text_transform */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_first_summary_row { padding-top: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_first_grand_summary_row { padding-top: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; border-top-style: double; border-top-width: 6px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_table_body { border-top-style: solid; /* table_body.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* table_body.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* table_body.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* table_body.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* table_body.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* table_body.border.bottom.color */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_footnotes { border-top-style: solid; /* footnotes.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* footnotes.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* footnotes.border.top.color */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_footnote { font-size: 90%; /* footnote.font.size */ margin: 0px; padding: 4px; /* footnote.padding */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_sourcenotes { border-top-style: solid; /* sourcenotes.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* sourcenotes.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* sourcenotes.border.top.color */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_sourcenote { font-size: 90%; /* sourcenote.font.size */ padding: 4px; /* sourcenote.padding */ } #hcnkufbbin .gt_center { text-align: center; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_left { text-align: left; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_right { text-align: right; font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_font_normal { font-weight: normal; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_font_bold { font-weight: bold; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_font_italic { font-style: italic; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_super { font-size: 65%; } #hcnkufbbin .gt_footnote_marks { font-style: italic; font-size: 65%; }   cyl N Frequency   4 11 0.34   6 7 0.22   8 14 0.44     Step 4: Ok, now adding some bells and whistles, we can really make this table shine…
mtcars %>% group_by(cyl) %>% summarize(N = n()) %>% mutate(Frequency = N/sum(N), Frequency = round(Frequency, 2)) %>% gt(rowname_col = "cyl") %>% tab_stubhead(label = "Cylinders") %>% tab_header( title = md("Table 1: MTCARS cyl table"), subtitle = md("Made with {gt} package") ) %>% tab_footnote( footnote = "Added a footnote", locations = cells_data( columns = vars(N), row = 1 #add to the row with 4 cylinders ) ) %>% tab_source_note( source_note = "Example 1: Add a source note here" ) %>% tab_source_note( source_note = "Example 2: Add another note/reference here!" ) %>% tab_options(heading.background.color = "#aa6f73", heading.border.bottom.color = "black", heading.title.font.size = 24, heading.subtitle.font.size = 22, table.width = 370, table.font.size = 18, column_labels.font.size = 20)  html { font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Helvetica Neue', 'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', Arial, sans-serif; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_table { display: table; border-collapse: collapse; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; color: #333333; font-size: 18px; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* table.background.color */ width: 370px; /* table.width */ border-top-style: solid; /* table.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* table.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #A8A8A8; /* table.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* table.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* table.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #A8A8A8; /* table.border.bottom.color */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_heading { background-color: #aa6f73; /* heading.background.color */ border-bottom-color: #FFFFFF; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_title { color: #FFFFFF; font-size: 24px; /* heading.title.font.size */ padding-top: 4px; /* heading.top.padding - not yet used */ padding-bottom: 4px; border-bottom-color: #FFFFFF; border-bottom-width: 0; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_subtitle { color: #FFFFFF; font-size: 22px; /* heading.subtitle.font.size */ padding-top: 0; padding-bottom: 4px; /* heading.bottom.padding - not yet used */ border-top-color: #FFFFFF; border-top-width: 0; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_bottom_border { border-bottom-style: solid; /* heading.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* heading.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: black; /* heading.border.bottom.color */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_column_spanner { border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-width: 2px; border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; padding-top: 4px; padding-bottom: 4px; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_col_heading { color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* column_labels.background.color */ font-size: 20px; /* column_labels.font.size */ font-weight: initial; /* column_labels.font.weight */ vertical-align: middle; padding: 5px; margin: 10px; overflow-x: hidden; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_columns_top_border { border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_columns_bottom_border { border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-width: 2px; border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_sep_right { border-right: 5px solid #FFFFFF; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_group_heading { padding: 8px; /* row_group.padding */ color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* row_group.background.color */ font-size: 16px; /* row_group.font.size */ font-weight: initial; /* row_group.font.weight */ border-top-style: solid; /* row_group.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* row_group.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.bottom.color */ vertical-align: middle; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_empty_group_heading { padding: 0.5px; color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* row_group.background.color */ font-size: 16px; /* row_group.font.size */ font-weight: initial; /* row_group.font.weight */ border-top-style: solid; /* row_group.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* row_group.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* row_group.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* row_group.border.bottom.color */ vertical-align: middle; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_striped { background-color: #8080800D; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_from_md  :first-child { margin-top: 0; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_from_md  :last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_row { padding-top: 8px; /* row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; margin: 10px; border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 1px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; vertical-align: middle; overflow-x: hidden; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_stub { border-right-style: solid; border-right-width: 2px; border-right-color: #D3D3D3; padding-left: 12px; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_summary_row { color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* summary_row.background.color */ padding-top: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; text-transform: inherit; /* summary_row.text_transform */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_grand_summary_row { color: #333333; background-color: #FFFFFF; /* grand_summary_row.background.color */ padding-top: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; text-transform: inherit; /* grand_summary_row.text_transform */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_first_summary_row { padding-top: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_first_grand_summary_row { padding-top: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-bottom: 8px; /* grand_summary_row.padding */ padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px; border-top-style: double; border-top-width: 6px; border-top-color: #D3D3D3; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_table_body { border-top-style: solid; /* table_body.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* table_body.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* table_body.border.top.color */ border-bottom-style: solid; /* table_body.border.bottom.style */ border-bottom-width: 2px; /* table_body.border.bottom.width */ border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3; /* table_body.border.bottom.color */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_footnotes { border-top-style: solid; /* footnotes.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* footnotes.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* footnotes.border.top.color */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_footnote { font-size: 90%; /* footnote.font.size */ margin: 0px; padding: 4px; /* footnote.padding */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_sourcenotes { border-top-style: solid; /* sourcenotes.border.top.style */ border-top-width: 2px; /* sourcenotes.border.top.width */ border-top-color: #D3D3D3; /* sourcenotes.border.top.color */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_sourcenote { font-size: 90%; /* sourcenote.font.size */ padding: 4px; /* sourcenote.padding */ } #zrmrjpcved .gt_center { text-align: center; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_left { text-align: left; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_right { text-align: right; font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_font_normal { font-weight: normal; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_font_bold { font-weight: bold; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_font_italic { font-style: italic; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_super { font-size: 65%; } #zrmrjpcved .gt_footnote_marks { font-style: italic; font-size: 65%; }    Table 1: MTCARS cyl table   Made with {gt} package    Cylinders N Frequency   4 111 0.34   6 7 0.22   8 14 0.44    Example 1: Add a source note here   Example 2: Add another note/reference here!    1  Added a footnote     &nbps;
Done!
Simply calling gt() creates the table, then add a few parameters to control the style/font size etc…Voila! You have a fancy gt Table…
summary:
In my job, I make tables all the time
I recently stumbled upon the {gt} package and whoa… these are some great looking tables! You can check out the vignettes here
Even better, they are simple to append to any dplyr pipeline…
Step 1: Load {gt} and {dplyr}
library(gt) library(dplyr)  Step 2:
 Create a simple frequency table, with mtcars, grouped by number of cylinders.
 Dplyr is fast and simple to use, but the console output is not so easy on the eyes…  mtcars %>% group_by(cyl) %>% summarize(N = n()) %>% mutate(Frequency = N/sum(N), Frequency = round(Frequency, 2)) ## # A tibble: 3 x 3 ## cyl N Frequency ## <dbl> <int> <dbl> ## 1 4 11 0.
title: GT tables

content:
Welcome to Slides Academic
Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides  Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E  Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")  Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = \;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears  Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view   Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links   night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links  Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}  Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }  Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.
title: Slides

Accuracy of sonographic estimated fetal weight in suspected macrosomia: the likelihood of overestimating and underestimating the true birthweight
